Package search

Class SearchProblem

java.lang.Object
search.SearchProblem
public abstract class SearchProblem extends Object
A problem defined for use with an AI search algorithm. This class must be extended with a specific class to define the problem, which implements all of the abstract methods.
Author:
Jeff Heflin, Lehigh University (heflin@cse.lehigh.edu)

  • Constructor Details

    • SearchProblem

      public SearchProblem()

  • Method Details

    • getInitialState

      public abstract State getInitialState()
      Return the initial state of the problem.

    • getSuccessors

      public abstract List<Successor> getSuccessors(State s)
      Get the successors of the input state. To simplify costing, instead of only returning <action,successor> pairs, we return step costs as well. This eliminates the need for a separate step cost function that takes a node, action and child state as input. The action is simply a string, and these strings are used for displaying the steps of the solution.

    • goalTest

      public abstract boolean goalTest(State currentState)
      Returns true if the parameter is a goal state.

    • getHeuristicValue

      public abstract int getHeuristicValue(State state)
      Returns the h(n) value for state parameter. Lower h(n) values are estimated to be closer to the goal.

    • extractPath

      public List<Action> extractPath(SearchNode node)
      Builds the path from the initial state to the current node. This is done by recursively following parent links to the root, and then add the actions that generated each node to an ArrayList.
